title: University Chinese I
description: This course aims to lead students to further enhance their analytical and writing skills with their existing Chinese foundation. Through the discussion and analysis of daily language materials and classic, students could initially acquire the procedures and methods of humanistic thinking, appreciate its beauty, and cultivate their ability and interest in reading. In addition, through systematic writing exercises, students could develop the habit of responding to the world with writings and expressing their thoughts and feelings through ingenuity. Students should complete this course within the first two years of their studies.
outcome: 預期修畢本課程，學生能夠：1. 透過增加對日常語文現象的認識，分析語文現象的規律，提高語文應用能力。2. 通過經典作品的精讀，了解其所蘊藏的人文思維，俾能識別文本的主要信息、並回應作者的審美態度。3. 透過系統性的寫作練習，增進語文表達及寫作能力，撰寫具創意的作品。4. 參與語文自學活動，提高語文自學能力。Upon completion of this course, students should be able to:1. improve their language ability by increasing their understanding of daily language phenomena and analyzing the rules of language phenomena.2. understand the humanistic thinking of classic through intensive reading, identify the main information of the text and respond to the author's aesthetic attitude.3. improve their expression and writing skills through systematic writing exercises to write creative works.4. participate in self-learning activities and improve their self-learning language ability.
syllabus: 內容包括：(1)常見語文現象分析；(2)經典作品的精讀；(3)寫作技巧及手法Contents include: (1) Analysis of common language phenomena; (2) Intensive reading of classic; (3) Writing skills and techniques
required_readings: 1. 香港中文大學中國語言及文學系編：《中大‧山水‧人文》，香港：牛津大學出版社，2012年。
recommended_readings: 1. 樊善標、陳燕遐、馬輝洪主編：《二十一世紀中大的一日》，香港：香港中文大學香港文學研究中心，2015年。2. 康寶文、萬波、張詠梅主編：《語文求真》，香港：三聯書店(香港)有限公司，2008年。3. 小思編：《香港文學散步》(增訂版)，香港：商務印書館，2007年。4. 黃伯榮、廖序東：《現代漢語》（增訂四版）。北京：高等教育出版社，2007年。5. 何成邦：《香港別字追蹤》（一）、（二），香港：明報出版社有限公司，2000、2001年。6. 呂叔湘：《現代漢語八百詞》，北京：商務印書館，1980年。7. 梅家駒主編：《現代漢語搭配詞典》，上海：漢語大詞典出版社，1999年。8. 郭錫良等編著：《古代漢語》（修訂本），北京：商務印書館，1999年。9. 陳瑞端：《生活錯別字》，香港：中華書局，1997年。10. 曾子凡：《廣州話．普通話語詞對比研究》（修訂版），香港：香港普通話研習社，2002年。11. 謝耀基：《現代漢語歐化語法概論》，香港：光明圖書公司，1990年。

title: University Chinese II
description: This course aims to lead students to further develop their evaluation and communication skills. Through in-depth discussion and analysis of classic, students would be familiar with the procedures and methods of humanistic thinking, and they could reflect and respond to the content and the form of expression. On this basis, this course explores various Chinese topics such as classical literature, modern literature, cultural thought, literature and life, and application in life, so that students could master the communication skills of works, and transfer and internalize them into their own expression and writing abilities to deepen their Chinese cultivation. Students should complete this course within the first two years of their studies.
outcome: 預期修畢本課程，學生能夠：1. 通過經典作品的精讀、解析及詮釋，回應及反思文本的思想內容及表達形式，提高評價能力。2. 透過深入了解特定的中文專題，系統地掌握其傳意技巧，以臻更深廣的中文修養。3. 參與語文自學活動，提高語文自學能力。Upon completion of this course, students should be able to:1. improve their evaluation ability by responding and reflecting on the content and the form of expression of the text through intensive reading, analysis, and interpretation of classic.2. systematically master the communication skills through in-depth understanding of special topics in Chinese, to achieve a deeper and broader Chinese cultivation.3. participate in self-learning activities and improve their self-learning language ability.
syllabus: 內容包括：(1)經典作品的詮釋及評價； (2)中文專題Contents include: (1) Interpretation and evaluation of classic; (2) Special topics in Chinese
required_readings: 1. 王聘興、趙總寬等著：《文章與邏輯》，北京：北京出版社，1982年。2. 陳碧月：《小說欣賞入門》，台北：五南圖書出版，2005年。3. 許榮哲：《小說課之王：折磨讀者的秘密》，台北：遠見天下文化，2020年。4. 愛德華．佛斯特著，蘇希亞著：《小說面面觀：現代小說寫作的藝術》，台北：商周，2009年。5. 寧宗一︰《中國小說學通論》，合肥：安徽教育出版社，1995年。6. 王濱、馬知遙：《影評寫作理論與實踐》，北京：中國戲劇出版社，2006年。7. 蒂莫西‧J‧科里根(Timothy J. Corrigan)著，宋美鳳、劉曦譯：《如何寫影評》，北京：北京聯合出版社，2018年。
recommended_readings: 1. 李錦昌編著：《現代商業傳意大全》，香港﹕商務印書館，2004年。2. 周錫(韋复)：《中文應用寫作教程》，香港：三聯書店，1996年。3. 胡裕樹：《大學寫作》，上海：復旦大學出版社，1985年。4. 香港城市大學語文學部：《中文傳意‧基礎篇》，香港：香港城市大學出版社，2001年。5. 黃桂林：《口才自學法》，香港﹕匯智出版有限公司，2004年。6. 羅鋼：《敘事學導論》，昆明：雲南人民出版社，1999年。7. 鄭樹森：《小說地圖》，台北：印刻，2007年。8. 李婉薇：《少即是多：短篇小說的10個關鍵詞》，香港：麥穗，2020年。9. 孫紹振：《經典小說解讀》，上海：上海教育出版社，2016年。10. 朱瑪、吳信訓︰《影評寫作》，武漢：湖北教育出版社，1985年。

title: University Chinese I
description: Course objectives: This course aims to sharpen students’ awareness of their own language and to intensify their sensitivity towards language in general. All students are recommended to complete the course in the first two years.

title: Communication in Chinese
description: This course is designed to enhance students’ written communication skills. Ancient and modern essays are taught, by which students can study ancient and modern Chinese grammar, vocabulary and structure and strengthen their language skills. To address the daily language needs of students, special emphasis will be placed on practical writing and writing in different geners. Online language learning tools will be introduced to the students to enhance their self-learning ability.

title: University Elementary Chinese I
description: This course is specially designed to lead students to a more advanced use of the Chinese language. It aims to consolidate students with the fundamental linguistic knowledge in various aspects. It enhances students' ability of language use, through selected linguistic disscussions and practical situations.
outcome: Upon completion of the course, students will be able to: [1] To acqurie basic linguistic knowledge of Chinese and to apply the knowledge in appropriate contexts. [2] To appreciate the Chinese language through readings of Chinese literature [3] To improve the self-learning strategies to raise the language ability   修畢本科後，學生能︰  [1] 掌握基本漢語知識，準確運用詞語和句式 [2] 通過文學作品欣賞漢語特點 [3] 善用自學策略，提升語文能力
syllabus: [1] basic Chinese grammar;  [2] practical writing; [3] appreciation of the Chinese language through traditional and local literature.  [1] 基本漢語語法；  [2] 寫作簡單應用文；  [3] 傳統及本地文學作品欣賞
required_readings: 1. Wang, Guo’an (ed.): A Handbook for 1000 Basic Chinese Characters. 2006 The Chinese University Press (Hong Kong)  2. Kane, Daniel﹕ The Chinese Language. Its History and Current Usage. 2006 Tuttle publishing  3. 郭振華﹕A Concise Chinese Grammar 簡明漢語語法. 2003 和平圖書有限公司 (香港)
recommended_readings: 1. Boltz, William G.: The Origin and Early Development of the Chinese Writing System. 2003 American Oriental Society. 2. DeFrancis, John: The Chinese Language Fact and Fantasy. 1984 Honolulu.  3. Blakney, R.B.: A course in the analysis of Chinese Characters. 1935 The Commercial Press, China. 4. Björkstén, Johan: Learn to write Chinese characters. 1994 Sweden.  5. McNaughton, William: Reading and writing Chinese. A guide to the Chinese writing system. 1979 Tokyo.

title: Self-Learning Elementary Chinese
description: This course is tailor-made for non-JUPAS students who are exempted by Senate from the Chinese language requirements for admission and are admitted on advanced standing to FYFD places at The Chinese University of Hong Kong. This course is an introductory course designed for beginners who do not have knowledge of Chinese, focusing on the methods of self-learning Chinese (including Mandarin, Cantonese, and Chinese characters). Students are expected to finish this course in one term and will be graded as “Pass” or “Failure”.
outcome: 1. Acquiring the basic methods of self-learning Chinese  　掌握自學中文的基本方法 2. Being able to find and use relevant learning tools and references for acquiring spoken Mandarin   能尋找和使用學習普通話口語的相關學習教材和參考文獻 3. Being able to find and use relevant learning tools and references for acquiring spoken Cantonese   能尋找和使用學習粵語口語的相關學習教材和參考文獻 4. Being able to find and use relevant learning tools and references for acquiring Chinese characters   能尋找和使用學習漢字的相關學習教材和參考文獻
syllabus: 本科包括以下的內容：  1. Basic linguistic knowledge of modern Chinese 現代漢語概論 2. Self-learning Mandarin 自學普通話 3. Self-learning Cantonese 自學粵語 4. Self-learning Chinese characters 自學漢字
required_readings: 中文系指定網上學習教材
recommended_readings: 1. Cheung, Hung-nin Samuel (in collaboration with Sze-yun Liu and Li-lin Shih). 1994. A Practical Chinese Grammar. Hong Kong: The Chinese University of Hong Kong Press. 2. McNaughton, William. 2005. Reading & Writing Chinese (Simplified Chinese Edition, revised edition). Hong Kong: Tuttle Publishing. 3. Lee, Yin-ping Cream and Shin Kataoka. 2013. A Short Cut to Cantonese (New Edition). Hong Kong: Greenwood Press. 4. 李德津、程美珍編著，李德津、金德厚修訂。2008。《外國人實用漢語語法》。北京：北京語言大學出版社。 5. 鄭國雄。2007。《歐美人學中文（初階練習本）》。傷害：復旦大學出版社。 6. 野露露、于素秋及來雲鶴主編，成蕾、韓秋紅翻譯。2003。《交際漢語1（連光盤）》。北京：科學普及出版社。 7. 野露露、于素秋及來雲鶴主編，成蕾、韓秋紅翻譯。2004。《交際漢語2（連光盤）》。北京：科學普及出版社。 8. 野露露、于素秋及來雲鶴主編，成蕾、韓秋紅翻譯。2004。《交際漢語3（連光盤）》。北京：科學普及出版社。 9. 野露露、于素秋及來雲鶴主編，成蕾、韓秋紅翻譯。2004。《交際漢語4（連光盤）》。北京：科學普及出版社。

title: Self-Learning Chinese
description: This course is tailor-made for non-JUPAS students who are admitted on advanced standing to FYFD places at The Chinese University of Hong Kong and are exempted from the 6-unit Chinese language of the University Core Requirements for fulfilment of the Chinese Language Requirements and is delivered via the web. The online self-learning system devised for the course will consist of 12 components in two parts ( zì cí piān字詞篇 and jù zi piān句子篇). This course is designed for improving the Chinese language standard of the students concerned at CUHK, covering various aspects of Chinese, such as words and grammar, argumentative and descriptive writing in order to increase the linguistic awareness of Chinese. The students are expected to finish the course by taking part in an online- examination.
outcome: 1. Acquiring linguistic features liu shu and the development of Chinese characters   掌握六書及漢字流變 2. Being able to recognize traditional Chinese characters and their counterparts in simplified forms   掌握繁體字和簡體字的對換規律 3. Being able to distinguish between synonyms and antonyms in Chinese   辨識中文不同的近義詞及反義詞 4. Acquiring linguistic features of Chinese morphology 認識中文的構詞法 5. Being able to distinguish between correct and incorrect forms of Chinese characters   辨識錯別字 6. Acquiring linguistic features of Chinese syntax    認識中文句法的特點 7. Acquiring linguistic knowledge of common grammar mistakes in Chinese sentences  認識病句類型  8. Being able to master Chinese conjunctions    正確使用中文關聯詞 9. Being able to translate phrases and sentences from English into simple Chinese  把英文詞語和句子翻譯成簡單的中文 10.  Being able to master Chinese punctuations  正確運用中文標點符號   11.  Being able to recognize Chinese rhetoric in descriptive writing  能分辨出描寫文中的修辭手法 12. Being able to understand and analyze relevant arguments in argumentative writing  能理解並分析作者的議論立場及理據。
syllabus: 本科共分「字詞篇」及「句子篇」兩部分，共計十二個單元，每單元介紹如下:  第一部分﹕「字詞篇」(六個單元)  1. 漢字六書和流變：Linguistic knowledge of liu shu and the development of Chinese characters 認識漢 字的六書原理和字形流變 2. 錯別字：Knowledge of correct and incorrect written forms of Chinese characters and reasons of writing errors 錯別字成因和類型 3. 繁體字和簡體字：Different features of traditional and simplified Chinese characters and rules of forming simplified Chinese characters 認識繁體字和簡體字的分別，以及簡體字構造規則 4. 同義詞和反義詞：Chinese synonyms and antonyms 認識中文近義詞、反義詞 5. 漢語構詞法﹕Acquiring linguistic features of Chinese morphology 認識中文詞語的構成方法和分類 6. 　閱讀理解（描寫文）：Comprehension of descriptive writing in Chinese 描寫文篇章閱讀  第二部分﹕「句子篇」(六個單元)  1. 漢語句法：Linguistic knowledge of basic Chinese grammar with a focus on sentence structure 認識基礎中文句語，以句子成分為主。 2. 漢語關聯詞：Linguistic knowledge and usage of conjunctions in Chinese grammar 學習中文不同類型的複句及其關聯詞 3. 漢語病句﹕Linguistic knowledge of common grammar mistakes in Chinese sentences 認識病句類型  4. 中英轉換：English-Chinese sentence translation 中、英句子翻譯 5. 　漢語標點：Linguistic knowledge and usage of Chinese punctuations 中文標點符號基本知識及運用 6.  閱讀理解（議論文）：Comprehension of argumentative writing in Chinese 議論篇章閱讀
required_readings: 中文系指定網上學習教材
recommended_readings: 1.王寧、鄒曉麗﹕詞滙。2005，和平圖書有限公司。 2.林西莉﹕漢字王國。2008，三聯書局。 3.邵敬敏﹕標點符號要訣。1999，香港商務印書館。 4.陳瑞端﹕生活錯別字。1997，香港﹕中華書局。 5.Brown, Semmi MC: Read and write Chinese. 2000 Greenwood Press (Hongkong) 6.卉君﹕漢語基本知識。1991，香港﹕商務印書館。  7.胡裕樹﹕現代漢語。1992，三聯書店。  8.張斌﹕漢語語法修辭常識。1991，香港﹕香港教育圖書公司。  9.香港城市大學語文學部﹕中文傳意(基礎篇)。 2006，香港城市大學出版社。  10.郭振華﹕A Concise Chinese Grammar 簡明漢語語法. 2003 和平圖書有限公司 (香港)

title: University Chinese II
description: Course objectives: University Chinese (II) focuses on students’ practical use of language, refining their skills in employing different communicative strategies to meet diverse contextual needs. All students are recommended to complete the course in the first two years.
outcome: 預期修畢本科目，學生能夠： 1. 提高語言自覺、語文自學能力，掌握漢語字、詞、句的特點及修辭技巧，並能正確運用。 2. 掌握議論思辨的技巧，提高說明及表達能力，建立批判性思維，俾能撰寫具說服力的議論文章，又能在口語溝通中應對自如。 3. 掌握觀察技巧，提高組織能力，並能學以致用，因應社會所需，撰寫各類實用文書。
syllabus: Course Outline: Topics include: 1. communication skills; 2. discourse and text analysis; 3. argumentative skills.  科目大綱：內容包括：(1)口語傳意技巧；(2) 篇章結構的組織方法；(3)議論思辨的技巧，包括確立論點、選取論據及論證的方法。
required_readings: 1. 王聘興、趙總寬等著：《文章與邏輯》，北京：北京出版社，1982年。 2. 劉豔春：《語言交際概論》，北京：北京大學出版社，2007年。
recommended_readings: 1. 李錦昌編著：《現代商業傳意大全》，香港﹕商務印書館，2004年。 2. 周錫(韋复)：《中文應用寫作教程》，香港：三聯書店，1996年。 3. 胡裕樹：《大學寫作》，上海：復旦大學出版社，1985年。 4. 香港城市大學語文學部：《中文傳意‧基礎篇》，香港：香港城市大學出版社，2001年。 5. 黃桂林：《口才自學法》，香港﹕匯智出版有限公司，2004年。

title: University Elementary Chinese II
description: This course aims to help students strengthen knowledge of the Chinese language in various aspects, and its comprehensive use, appreciate linguistic differences between Chinese and English, similarities and differences between Cantonese and Putonghua, and acquire academic writing strategies in Chinese.
outcome: Upon completion of the course, students will be able to: [1] To strengthen the knowledge of Chinese, [2] To improve the ability of practical Chinese writing for academic purpose, [3] To acquire the basic English-Chinese translation skills.  修畢本科後，學生能︰ [1] 鞏固漢語知識 [2] 提升中文學術寫作 [3] 掌握英漢翻譯的基本技巧
syllabus: [1] sentence structure [2] the use of idioms [3] practical English-Chinese translation  [4] explanatory and argumentative essays [5] Chinese for academic purpose  [1] 句子結構； [2] 成語運用； [3] 實務書信英漢翻譯； [4] 說明文章、評論文章； [5] 中文學術寫作
required_readings: 1. Chao, Yuen Ren趙元任: A Grammar of Spoken Chinese. 1968 University of California Press (Berkeley) 2. Yip, Po-Ching and Don Rimmington: Basic Chinese: A Grammar and Workbook. 2009 (Second Edition) Routledge (London and New York) 3. . Yip, Virginia and Stephen Matthews. Basic Cantonese : a grammar and workbook. 2000. London ; New York : Routledge
recommended_readings: 1. Chao, Yuen Ren: Readings in Sayable Chinese. 1968-1969 Asian Language Publications (San Francisco) 2. Deng, Yi鄧懿 et al.: Elementary Chinese Course漢語初級教程. 1993 Beijing Daxue Chubanshe (Beijing). vols. 3-4 3. Ma, Jing-Heng Sheng馬盛靜恆: Keys to Chinese Language漢語入門. 2006 The Chinese University Press (Hong Kong), Book II 4. Ho, Ching-hsien: Elementary Chinese. 1973 Cheng Chung Shuchü (Taipei). vol. 2 5. Jamieson, John C. and Lin, Tao: Kung Fu: An Elementary Chinese Text. 2002 The Chinese University Press (Hong Kong), Book II  6. Li, Charles N. and Thompson, Sandra A.: Mandarin Chinese: a Functional Reference Grammar. 1981 University of California Press (Berkeley) 7. Rouzer, Paul F.: A New Practical Primer of Literary Chinese. 2007 Harvard University Press (Cambridge, Massachusetts)

title: Chinese Language Communication and Application I
description: This course is specially designed to lead students to a more advanced use of the Chinese language. It aims to consolidate students with the fundamental linguistic knowledge in various aspects. It enhances students' ability of language use and communication skills, through selected linguistic discussions and practical situations.
outcome: Upon completion of the course, students will be able to:[1] acquire basic linguistic knowledge of Chinese and to apply the knowledge in appropriate contexts[2] appreciate the Chinese language through readings of Chinese literature[3] improve the self-learning strategies to raise the language ability[4] acquire practical writing skills修畢本科後，學生能︰[1] 掌握基本漢語知識，準確運用詞語和句式[2] 通過文學作品欣賞漢語特點[3] 善用自學策略，提升語文能力[4] 掌握實務文書寫作技巧
syllabus: [1] basic Chinese grammar;[2] practical writing;[3] appreciation of the Chinese language through traditional and local literature.[1] 基本漢語語法；[2] 寫作簡單應用文；[3] 傳統及本地文學作品欣賞
required_readings: 1. Wang, Guo'an. 2006. A Handbook for 1000 Basic Chinese Characters. Hong Kong: The Chinese University Press.2. Kane, Daniel. 2006. The Chinese Language. Its History and Current Usage. North Clarendon: Tuttle Publishing.3. 郭振華. 2003. A Concise Chinese Grammar 簡明漢語語法. 香港：和平圖書有限公司.
recommended_readings: 1. Boltz, William G. 2003. The Origin and Early Development of the Chinese Writing System. New Haven: American Oriental Society.2. DeFrancis, John. 1984. The Chinese Language Fact and Fantasy. Honolulu: University of Hawaii Press.3. Blakney, R.B.: 1935. A Course in the Analysis of Chinese Characters. Shanghai: The Commercial Press.4. Björkstén, Johan. 1994. Learn to Write Chinese Characters. New Haven: Yale. University Press.5. McNaughton, William. 1979. Reading and Writing Chinese. A Guide to the Chinese Writing System. Tokyo: Tuttle Company.

title: Chinese Language Communication and Application II
description: This course is specially designed to consolidate students’ Chinese knowledge in various aspects and to further improve their use of Chinese language. It provides diversified and practical teaching materials to help students deepen Chinese knowledge and communication skills, master their Chinese writing skills in various topics, and to cultivate their self-learning ability.
outcome: Upon completion of the course, students will be able to:[1] enhance the knowledge of Chinese and the ability of practical use of Chinese in different context;[2] acquire Chinese writing skills in various topics, such as short reviews or multimedia writing, etc;[3] improve the self-learning strategies to strengthen the language ability.預期修畢本課程後，學生能夠：[1] 鞏固漢語知識，提高在不同語境中的語文應用能力；[2] 掌握中文專題寫作技巧，例如短篇評論或多媒體寫作等；[3] 善用自學策略，鞏固語文能力。
syllabus: [1] Topics in Chinese language, such as the use of different Chinese words in different regions[2] Chinese writing skills in various topics, such as short reviews or multimedia writing, etc.[3] Introduction of self-learning strategies[1] 漢語知識專題，例如不同地區的漢語用詞差異；[2] 中文專題寫作，例如短篇評論或多媒體寫作等；[3] 自學策略介紹
required_readings: 1. Chao, Yuen Ren趙元任: A Grammar of Spoken Chinese. 1968 University of California Press (Berkeley)2. Yip, Po-Ching and Don Rimmington: Basic Chinese: A Grammar and Workbook. 2009 (Second Edition) Routledge (London and New York)3. Yip, Virginia and Stephen Matthews. Basic Cantonese : a grammar and workbook. 2000. London ; New York : Routledge
recommended_readings: 1. Deng, Yi鄧懿 et al.: Elementary Chinese Course漢語初級教程. 1993 Beijing Daxue Chubanshe (Beijing). vols. 3-4.2. Ma, Jing-Heng Sheng馬盛靜恆: Keys to Chinese Language漢語入門. 2006 The Chinese University Press (Hong Kong), Book II.3. Ho, Ching-hsien: Elementary Chinese. 1973 Cheng Chung Shuchü (Taipei). vol. 2.4. Jamieson, John C. and Lin, Tao: Kung Fu: An Elementary Chinese Text. 2002 The Chinese University Press (Hong Kong), Book II.5. Li, Charles N. and Thompson, Sandra A.: Mandarin Chinese: a Functional Reference Grammar. 1981 University of California Press (Berkeley).6. Rouzer, Paul F.: A New Practical Primer of Literary Chinese. 2007 Harvard University Press (Cambridge, Massachusetts).

title: Creative Chinese Writing
description: This course aims to enhance students’ writing ability by activating their creative thinking through different creative writing skills and extensive writing exercise.

title: Oral Communication Skills
description: Inter-personal communication is valued in modern society. Very often, eloquence has profound influence on the success of one's study and career. This course aims to develop students' competence in oral communication with simulation practices in different situations.

title: Practical Chinese Writing
description: This course aims to enhance students’ command of Chinese writing for practical usage by the means of interactive teaching and learning activities. The teaching content is designed according to the actual needs for their further studies and careers development in Hong Kong which includes personal letter, letter for administrative or commercial communication, proposal, report, slide presentation and email etc. Students will acquire the necessary knowledge on the criterion of proper expression from real-life Chinese writing examples as well as the standard format of different Chinese practical writing.
outcome: 預期修畢本科目，學生能夠︰1.認識本地語境中實用中文的應用情況及特點2.掌握實用中文寫作於遣詞用字、內容鋪排、行文格式等方面的規範，提高其實用中文寫作的表述能力；3.選用適切的文體及得體的措辭撰寫中文實用文書，應對未來學習、生活及工作等方面的中文應用需要；
syllabus: 實用中文寫作通則 (內容鋪排、措辭及語氣) 自我介紹 撮要及電子簡報 校園實務文書︰自薦信、應徵信及中文電郵 行政實務文書︰公函與便箋 商業實務文書︰計畫書及報告 公關實務文書︰聲明及禮儀文書
required_readings: 1. 陳耀南《應用文概說》，香港︰山邊出版社，1985年。2. 公務員事務局《政府公文寫作手冊》(第三版)
recommended_readings: 1. 香港城巿大學語文學部編著︰《中文傳意︰寫作篇》，香港︰香港城巿大學出版社，2001年。2. 于成鯤等著《中國內地實用文闡釋》，香港︰香港教育圖書公司，2004年。3. 岑紹基《應用文的語言、語境、語用》，香港︰香港教育圖書公司，2006年。4. 李錦昌《商業溝通與應用文大全》，香港︰商務印書館，2012年。5. 何偉幟《跟喬布斯學Power point 演說︰個人及小組報告演講策略》，香港︰萬里機構，2013年。6. 朱少璋《魚雁志－－應用文措辭例話及文化趣談》，香港︰匯智出版社，2017年。7. 楊興安《現代書信》，香港︰天地圖書公司，2014年。8. 黃毓楝等著︰《10分鐘寫好商業中文電郵》，香港︰經濟日報出版社，2017年。

title: Image and Writing
description: This course illustrates the related concepts of image and writing, guiding students to appreciate the language and artistic characteristics of image and writing by reading works of different media and types. This would enhance students' appreciation, expression, and creativity.

title: Cantonese Phonetics and Jyutping
description: This course aims to enhance students' ability in verbal communication in Cantonese by introducing its sound system and Romanisation method (Jyutping).
outcome: 預期修畢本科目，學生能夠：1. 提高語言自覺能力，了解粵語作為漢語分支的語音特點。2. 提高口語表達能力，掌握粵語的拼寫方法。
syllabus: Topics include: 1. The general knowledge of Cantonese as a branch of Chinese; 2. Verbal communication skills; 3. Cantonese consonants, vowels and tones and its romanisation system 內容包括: (1) 粵語作為漢語分支的特點; (2) 粵語的聲母、韻母、聲調與拼音方法   1. Introduction 1. 導論   2. Overview of Cantonese sound system 2. 粵語音系   3. Cantonese consonants 3. 粵語輔音   4. Cantonese vowels 4. 粵語元音   5. Cantonese syllabic structure 5. 粵語音節結構   6. Articulation of initials 6. 聲母的發音分法   7. Articulation of rhymes 7. 韻母的發音分法   8. Tones 8. 聲調   9. LSHK Romanisation 9. 香港語言學學會粵語拼音分案   10. Conclusion 10. 總結
required_readings: 鄧思穎：《粵語語法講義》，香港：商務印書館，2015年。香港城市大學語文學部：《中文傳意‧基礎篇》，香港：香港城市大學出版社，2001年。
recommended_readings: 黃桂林：《口才自學法》，香港﹕匯智出版有限公司，2004年。劉豔春：《語言交際概論》，北京：北京大學出版社，2007年。香港語言學學會：《粵語拼音字表》，香港：香港語言學學會，1997年。袁家驊：《漢語方言概要》（第二版），北京：語文出版社，2001年。詹伯慧：《廣東粵方言概要》，廣州：暨南大學出版社，2002年。張洪年：《香港粤語語法的研究》，香港：中文大學出版社，2007年。Chan Sin-wai, ed. 2016. The Routledge Encyclopedia of the Chinese Language, London: Routledge.

title: Advertising Copywriting
description: This course illustrates the related concepts, theories, writing methods and techniques of advertising copywriting. Through discussions of several types of works, students could analyze the language characteristics and writing techniques of advertising copywriting. This enhances students' expression, creation, and appreciation ability.

title: Nature Writing
description: This course aims to introduce students to nature writings in different genres which not only help expand students’ vocabulary but also guide them to observe and appreciate the nature in daily life. Reflecting on the literary works, students will learn and be encouraged to fabricate their own accounts more expressively, meticulously, and imaginatively, hence improving their creative writing skills and literary sensibility.

title: Classical Poetry Writing in the Modern Era
description: Classical Chinese poetry is beautiful in its expression as the works of famed poets can attest. The reason poems endure timelessly lies in how they reflect the times. Classical poetry written by modern poets can especially reflect the interplay between tradition and modern innovation. This course introduces the methods, metrics and forms of classical poetry through appreciating modernly written poetry in juxtaposition with poetry of the Tang and Song dynasties. Students will understand how classical poetry written by modern and contemporary poets strive for creativity and innovation. They can then apply what they have learned to writing classical poetry that conforms to metrical norms without any loss of aesthetics, all the while instilling modernity and innovation in their creations. Therefore, the ability of Chinese and writing will be enhanced.

title: Classical Poetry in Modern Language Applications
description: This course aims to improve students’ writing ability by applying ancient Chinese language through classical Chinese poetry and modern writing materials. Students will learn how to apply classical poetry and its linguistic features to various modern daily writings, such as slogans, inscriptions, couplets and prose. This will enhance the literary quality of the work and improve students’ writing ability as well as language proficiency.

title: The Literature of Love
description: This course delves into the art of crafting eloquent expressions of love in the realm of everyday life Chinese Language. By employing thought-provoking writing prompts, students will learn how to express their complex emotions associated with love. Participants will also have the opportunity to articulate their feelings, thoughts, and experiences evoked by their engagement with carefully curated works of Chinese Language. Throughout the course, students will hone their skills in crafting various forms of literary compositions centered around the theme of love, including short stories, diary entries, poetry, lyrics, prose, and scripts. By actively engaging in diverse in-class activities, students will broaden their perspectives and gain insights into an extensive range of possibilities associated with writing about love. Moreover, they will develop the ability to critically assess their own work, as well as the writings of their peers, arousing their language awareness in catching every nuance of love-centered expression.

title: Modern Poetry Writing
description: The course introduces the features and writing techniques of modern poetry, and leads students to write modern poetry with various topics on daily life. Through reading, in-class exercise, writing, and discussion on modern poetry, students are expected to acquire the creative skills and express their feelings and reflection about daily life in modern poetry writing.

title: Creative Writing and Literary Appreciation
description: This course aims at developing a student's skill in creative writing. It also focuses on practical approaches to teaching creative writing in high schools. Under the instructor's guidance, students will have hands-on experience in creative writing, and in learning how to appreciate various literary genres by sharing their experiences in class.
outcome: 預期修畢本科後，學生能够：  1. 掌握創作不同類型現代文學作品之技巧。 2. 掌握評鑑文學創作之方法。
syllabus: 1) Imagination and factuality in creative writing; 2) Writing and appreciation of modern poetry; 3) Writing and appreciation of fiction; 4) Writing and appreciation of drama; 5) Writing and appreciation of prose 一）文學創作中的想像與真實；二）新詩試寫及鑑賞；三）小說試寫及鑑賞；四）戲劇試寫及鑑賞；五）散文試寫及鑑賞
required_readings: 1.香港中文大學香港文學研究中心編著：《疊印：漫步香港文學地景》，香港：商務書館(香港)有限公司，2016年。 2.董啟章：《貝貝的文字冒險：植物咒語的奧秘》，香港：董富記文字工藝，2000年。 3.嶺南大學人文學科研究中心編著，梁秉鈞策劃：《跟白先勇一起創作：嶺大文學創作坊筆記》，香港：香港教育圖書公司，2008年。
recommended_readings: 1.王鼎鈞：《作文七巧》，台北：作者出版，1984年。 2.白靈：《一首詩的玩法》，台北：九歌出版社，2004年。 3.張大春：《小說稗類》(I, II)，台北：聯合文學，1998年。 4.梁實秋等著：《寫作研究》，台北：中國語文月刊社，1973年。 5.詹宏志：《創意人：創意思考的自我訓練》，台北：麥田出版股份有限公司，1996年。 6.蕭蕭：《現代詩創作演練》，台北：爾雅出版社，1991年。 7.賴聲川：《賴聲川的創意學》，台北：天下雜誌股份有限公司，2006年。

title: Chinese for Business Planning
description: This course aims to introduce to students various kinds of commercial writing for business planning such as statement, proposal, budget, and management plan. It also heightens important issues such as data collection, case analysis, and the weighing of advantages and disadvantages that will be involved in the whole planning process so that students will be better prepared for such challenges in their future work in the commercial sector for strategic business planning.

title: Chinese for Business Promotion
description: This course aims to acquaint students with various kinds of business writing for the promotion of better business in their future practice of marketing and advertising campaigns. It also prepares students with the requisite writing skills and specific techniques. Students will be conversant with all typical commercial writings for business promotion plus a better understanding of promotional target, conceptual design and media characteristics.

title: Speech and Negotiation
description: Speech and negotiation, which play a key role in modern lives, are important oral communication skills. Effective use of the two skills is of great assistance to interpersonal communication, social interaction, commercial negotiation and crisis management. With simulation practices of different nature and in different contexts, this course aims to develop students' skills in delivering speeches and in negotiation with application in daily life and work context.

title: Prose Writing and Appreciation
description: This course aims to develop students’ skills in creative Chinese prose writing and in learning how to appreciate modern prose of different genres. By means of the analysis of works in modern prose, students will be equipped with solid writing skills and appreciation methods through various writing tasks.

title: Chinese Writing under Globalization
description: This course is designed for students to enhance their Chinese writing skills so as to cultivate the ability of bilingual studies in the university. Special emphasis will be placed on differentiating Chinese from English in expressing the same concepts or ideas. In view of rapid globalization through internet in recent years and the primacy of the English language as an international medium of communication, it is necessary for students to grasp the essence of fluent, concise, and accurate Chinese. By extension, the course also aims to improve students’ skills at overall thought and expression. Learning materials used in this course encompass a wide variety of practical writings like newspaper articles, magazine reviews, as well as scholarly writings like research papers particularly with regard to globalization and international relations.

title: Classics and Life: Appreciation and Application of Chinese Classics
description: This course aims at leading students to study, understand, appreciate various works from ancient Chinese classics which reveal different aspects in human life. Related readings include Confucian, historical, philosophical and literary works. Besides empathising with our ancient sages, the course will go through and realize the invaluable experiences and thoughts which could serve as useful life guidance, ultimately let the classics to play their positive function for our lives.

title: Food Writing
description: This course illustrates the types and development of food writing. Through discussions of several types of works by writers from different regions, students could observe the various appearances and tastes of food, explore its connotations of literature, culture, region and history, and enhance students' creation and appreciation ability.

title: Plants and Literature
description: Plants are often one of the themes in Chinese literature, and it is important to know the symbolic meanings of the plants in literature so that we can understand and appreciate literary text through the plants. This course aims to introduce students to the origin, forms, and contents of Chinese culture and literature through studying plants. Students will be able to attain a new perspective of Chinese literature appreciation.

title: Appreciation of Masterpieces of Classical Chinese Literature
description: This course is designed for high-school language teachers, focusing on guided reading and explication of important texts selected from various genres of traditional literature. It is expected that a close reading of these texts will help students improve their understanding of traditional aesthetics, sharpen their sense and sensibility and master the methodologies of analyzing literary texts of different genres and styles. 1) Poetry: 1.1 Origins, development and characteristics of traditional poetry; 1.2 Old-style poetry; 1.3 Modern-style poetry; 1.4 Song lyrics; 1.5 Anthologies and their studies. 2) Prose: 2.1 Origins, development and characteristics of traditional prose; 2.2 Ancient-style prose of the pre-Qin era and Han Dynasties; 2.3 Ancient-style prose of Tang and Song Dynasties; 2.4 Informal essays of Ming and Qing Dynasties; 2.5 Anthologies and their studies. 3) Drama: 3.1 Origins, development and characteristics of traditional drama; 3.2 Zaju; 3.3 Chuanqi; 3.4 Anthologies and their studies. 4) Fiction: 4.1 Origins, development and characteristics of traditional fiction; 4.2 Short stories; 4.3 Novels; 4.4 Traditional fiction commentaries and their studies.
outcome: 預期修畢本科後，學生能够：  1. 熟悉中國古典文學經典作品，了解各種文體之特徵。 2. 提高文學鑑賞能力。 3. 掌握賞析文學作品方法。
syllabus: (1) 古典詩詞名篇鑑賞 1.1 詩詞格律原理 1.2 名家詩詞選讀 (2) 古典文章名篇鑑賞 2.1 文章體式辨別 2.2 散體及韻文選讀 (3) 戲曲小說名著鑑賞 3.1 戲曲選讀 3.2 小說選讀
required_readings: (1) 李白(〈夢遊天姥吟留別〉、〈古風〉、〈蜀道難〉等) 、杜甫(〈自京赴奉先縣詠懷五百字〉、〈詠懷古跡五首〉、〈秋興八首〉等) 、白居易(〈長恨歌〉、〈新樂府〉等)、李商隱(〈無題〉、〈錦瑟〉等)、黃庭堅(〈寄黃幾復〉) 、吳梅村(〈圓圓曲〉)等名家古近體詩作。 (2) 溫庭筠(〈菩薩蠻〉、〈更漏子〉等)、韋莊(〈菩薩蠻〉)、馮延巳(〈蝶戀花〉)、李煜(〈虞美人〉、〈浪淘沙〉等)、柳永(〈八聲甘州〉、〈雨霖鈴〉等)、蘇軾(〈江城子〉、〈念奴嬌〉等)、辛棄疾(〈永遇樂〉、〈水龍吟〉等)、李清照(〈聲聲慢〉)、王國維(〈菩薩蠻〉)等名家詞作。 (3)《戰國策‧馮諼客孟嘗君》、王勃(〈秋日登洪府滕王閣餞別詩序〉)、韓愈(〈送董邵南序〉、〈送孟東野序〉等)、柳宗元(「永州八記」、〈種樹郭橐駝傳 〉等)、 歐陽修(〈秋聲賦〉、〈朋黨論〉等)、蘇軾(〈留侯論〉、〈前赤壁賦〉等)、姚鼐(〈復魯潔非書〉)等名家古文。 (4) 施耐庵(《水滸傳》)、 羅貫中(《三國演義》)、 吳承恩(《西遊記》)、蘭陵笑笑生(《金瓶梅》)、曹雪芹(《紅樓夢》)、湯顯祖(《牡丹亭》)、馮夢龍(《喻世明言》、《警世通言》、《醒世恒言》)、凌濛初(《初刻拍案驚奇》、《二刻拍案驚奇》)、洪昇(《長生殿》)等名家小說戲曲。
recommended_readings: 一. 袁行霈主編：《中國文學作品選》（四卷）北京：中華書局，2007年。 二. 梁蕭統編，唐李善注：《文選》，上海：上海古籍出版社，1986年。 三. 錢鍾書選註：《宋詩選注》，北京：人民文學出版社，1982年。 四. 中國社會科學院文學硏究所編：《唐宋詞選》，北京：人民文學出版社，1981年。 五. 王力著 ：《詩詞格律》，香港：中華書局(香港)有限公司, 2002年。 六. 王起主編：《中國戲曲選》（三冊），北京：人民文學出版社, 1985 年。 七. 湯顯祖著，徐朔方、楊笑梅校注：《牡丹亭》，北京：人民文學出版社，1978年。. 八. 馮夢龍、凌濛初編著：《三言二拍》，北京：北京出版社，2006年。 九. 各種版本之《水滸傳》、《三國演義》、《西遊記》、《金瓶梅》、《紅樓夢》。

title: Appreciation of Masterpieces of Modern Chinese Literature
description: This course is designed for high-school language teachers. It aims at enhancing their skills in and knowledge of appreciating and teaching modern Chinese literature from aesthetic, historical and cultural perspectives. Major works of fiction, poetry, prose and drama will be discussed, strategies of textual interpretation explored, and formal characteristics and central themes of modern Chinese literature expounded. Key reference works will also be introduced.

title: Selected Readings in the Classics of Ancient Texts
description: This course is designed for high-school language teachers. It aims at enhancing their skills in and knowledge of appreciating the Confucian classics (jing), historical writings (shi) and philosophical treatises (zi) through guided readings of canonical texts. Traditional annotations, vernacular translations, excavated texts and modern reference books will be utilized in the explication of these texts and their tenets. 1) Selected readings in Confucian texts: 1.1 Selected readings of the Five Classics; 1.2 Annotations and commentaries of the Han and Tang Dynasties; 1.3 Modern vernacular translations; 1.4 Excavated texts; 1.5 Major reference books on Confucian texts; 2) Selected Readings in Philosophical Treatises: 2.1 Selected Readings of philosophical texts of various school (focusing on Daoist and Legalist texts); 2.2 Traditional annotations; 2.3 Modern vernacular translations; 2.4 Excavated texts; 2.5 Major reference books on philosophical treatises; 3) Selected Readings in Historical Writings: 3.1 Selected readings of four canonical works (focusing on Records of the Grand Historian and History of the Former Han Dynasty); 3.2 Traditional annotations; 3.3 Modern vernacular translations; 3.4 Major reference books on historical writings

title: Introduction to Classical Chinese
description: An introduction to various characteristic features of Classical Chinese. Topics include Chinese character, vocabulary, grammar and phonology. Major reference works will be also examined.

title: Introduction to Modern Chinese
description: This course provides a general survey of modern Chinese, including its sounds, vocabulary and grammar. Attention will also be given to the structure and development of Chinese characters. Students will acquire a comprehensive understanding of the language and will be adequately prepared for future explorations in linguistic studies.
outcome: 預期修畢本科後，學員能够：  1. 認識現代漢語的聲、韻、調系統。 2. 辨析語素、字、詞的異同。 3. 掌握詞義辨析的原理。 4. 掌握現代漢語基本的語法特點。 5. 認識漢字的造字原理、字體的演變和繁簡字的對應。
syllabus: 1) Phonology: 1.1 Phonological system of modern Chinese; 1.2 The Pinyin romanization system; 1.3 Tones and recitation; 2) Vocabulary: 2.1 Morephemes, words and vocabulary; 2,2 Components of words; 2.3 Polysemes, synonyms and antonyms; 3) Grammar: 3.1 Parts of speech; 3.2 Phrases; 3.3 Sentences and Their Components; 3.4 Compound Sentences; 4) Chinese characters writing system: 4.1 Characteristics and Components of Chinese characters; 4.2 Evolution of Chinese characters and scripts; 4.3 Codification of Chinese characters and scripts 一）語音： 1.1 現代漢語的語音系統；1.2 漢語拼音方案；1.3 語調和朗讀；二）詞匯：2.1 語素、詞、詞匯；2.2 詞的構造； 2.3 多義詞、同義詞、反義詞；三）語法：3.1 詞類；3.2 短語；3.3 句子和句子成分；3.4 複句；四）文字： 4.1 漢字的特點和結構； 4.2 漢字的發展； 4.3 漢字的規範
required_readings: 1. 朱德熙：《語法講義》。北京：商務印書館，1982。 2. 朱德熙：《語法答問》。北京：商務印書館，1999。 3. 朱德熙：《語法分析講稿》。北京：商務印書館，2010。 4. 沈家煊：《語法六講》。北京：商務印書館，2011。 5. 張斌：《現代漢語語法十講》。上海：復旦大學出版社，2005。 6. 趙元任：《漢語口語語法》(呂叔湘譯本)。北京：商務印書館，1979。
recommended_readings: 1. 胡裕樹主編：《現代漢語》(增訂本)，香港：三聯書店，1992年。 2. 胡裕樹主編：《現代漢語參考資料》上、下冊，上海：上海教育出版社，1982年。 3. 黃伯榮、廖序東主編：《現代漢語》(增訂三版)上、下冊，北京：高等教育出版社，2002年。 4. 呂叔湘：《現代漢語八百詞》，北京：商務印書館，1980年。

title: Introduction to Chinese Classic Texts and Culture
description: This course aims at illustrating the relationship between Chinese classic texts and Chinese culture. Through discussions of important passages in Confucian and Daoism, students can have a general picture of these philosophical schools and comprehend special features of Chinese tradition, beliefs, and values.
